pdhp358:1: The eightfold is the best of paths, four principles the best of truths,
pdhp358:2: dispassion the best of states, the Visionary the best of men.
pdhp359:1: The path was declared by me, the removal of the dart by knowledge,
pdhp359:2: your duty is to have ardour declare the Realised Ones,
pdhp359:3: entering this path meditators will be released from the bonds of Māra.
pdhp360:1: This is the path, there is no other, for insight and for purity,
pdhp360:2: you should enter upon this path, this is the confounding of Māra,
pdhp360:3: having entered upon this path you will make an end to suffering.
pdhp361:1: Cut down the forest of defilements not just the trees, from the forest arises a danger,
pdhp361:2: having cut down the forest and thicket, you will go further without forests.
pdhp362:1: For as long as an atom of desire of a man for his kin is not cut down,
pdhp362:2: the mind is in bondage there, like a calf in bondage to mother’s milk.
pdhp363:1: Cut off any affection for one’s self, like an autumn lotus plucked with the hand,
pdhp363:2: develop fully the path to peace and Nibbāna taught by the Fortunate One.
pdhp364:1: Here I will make the rains retreat, here during winter and summer,
pdhp364:2: in just such a way a fool thinks, not understanding the danger.
pdhp365:1: That person whose mind is attached and besotted by cattle and children,
pdhp365:2: is snatched away by death just as a sleeping village by a great flood.
pdhp366:1: Children are not a refuge, nor fathers, not even brothers,
pdhp366:2: for one afflicted by the End-Maker there is no refuge in relatives.
pdhp367:1: Relatives cry and wail together in this way
pdhp367:2: people still depart, against their desires they give him up.
pdhp368:1: Understanding this the sage, wise, free of selfishness,
pdhp368:2: should constantly purify the path that is leading to heaven.
pdhp369:1: Therefore a wise man looking for his own welfare
pdhp369:2: should constantly purify the path that is leading to heaven.
pdhp370:1: Endowed with faith and virtue, wise, well-composed,
pdhp370:2: one constantly purifies the path, which brings safety in the next world.
pdhp371:1: Endowed with faith and virtue, wise, composed,
pdhp371:2: delights in practising the path, delights in internal peace.
pdhp372:1: Endowed with faith and virtue, always delighting in being wise,
pdhp372:2: one advances like burning fire against the fetter, small or large,
pdhp372:3: whether it is wicked conceit or hypocrisy.
pdhp373:1: All conditions are impermanent, when one sees this with wisdom,
pdhp373:2: then one grows tired of suffering—this is the path to purity.
pdhp374:1: All components of mind and body are without self, when one sees this with wisdom,
pdhp374:2: then one grows tired of suffering—this is the path to purity.
pdhp375:1: From effort originates wisdom, without effort wisdom is destroyed,
pdhp375:2: having understood these two paths of development and decline,
pdhp375:3: the sage should train so that his wisdom increases.
